caption: The White Belt was fresh and tasty. They use chicken broth on this particular ramen.

Prices are just obscene. Small bowl of ramen with an egg is 17 dollars. Every other neighboring store can give you double the food for $10-11.  It’s an ok bowl of ramen in a plastic bowl. Price it as such.

Efficient service but with subpar quality of food. Noodles and broth taste only slightly better than cheap instant noodles. Noodles are too soft. The broth tastes like something made by mixing condensed paste without much complexity and depth of flavors. The slice of pork is thin but not tender. It's relatively inexpensive compared to other ramen noodles in the city, if you don't demand authentic quality ramen.

Great place for ramen. Portions are generous for a decent price. I tried the yellow belt, brown belt, and black belt ramen. The black belt, also called Kuro-Obi ramen, was my favorite; lot of flavor but not too salty. 10/10 would recommend 👍

Just finished eating a bowl of the kuro-obi ramen. Everything was pretty good,  especially the broth and the noodles. The pork felt a little incomplete in some way and the soup could have used another veggie component. Serving size was a little smaller than other ramen places around, but the price was also lower than other places nearby. I'm happy they decided on the lower price point and am fine with smaller portions to get there.
